result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter Regas

records.addlTxt: requesting a extension of time to file the report, filed.  rmm
for Competency Examination, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Peter Regas in court.  Attorney Eric m Hailstock Mr in court for Peter Regas.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for status conference.  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit on 10/25/22 at 10:00. Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 1.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10.4.22, filed.  rmm
Court ordered the defendant to have no contact with South 46th Street.

Defendant Peter Regas in court.  Attorney Eric m Hailstock Mr in court for Peter Regas.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Atty. Hailstock is not ready to proceed and requests a status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 09-08-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Peter Regas in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  
Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Calendar call held.  Court ordered the stayed warrant vacated.  Atty. Hailstock requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Eric m Hailstock in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      
Case in Court for Bail/bond hearing. Defendant is not present, no longer in custody. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case remains calendared in Br. 01.  Calendar call scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eric m Hailstock in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Attorney Hailstock was recently appointed and is requesting the bail/bond hearing be rescheduled to allow time to discuss with defendant. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Court ordered no contact with KTM, his family or his residence, S.R., her family or her residence.  Franklin High School or Franklin Elementary School.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Peter Regas in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Peter Regas in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
